headline: Corporate breakups are on the rise. What's behind the trend?
summary: There's a new trend on Wall Street this year: companies breaking up. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter David Hollerith joins Asking for a Trend with Josh Lipton to explain why so many companies have been splitting up into separate factions in 2025, whether this practice can unlock even more value, and what the outlook for this pattern looks like for the rest of 2025. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Wall Street is falling in love with the corporate breakup. Here's why.
summary: 2025 is turning out to be a big year for breakups. Whether by offloading a business unit, spinning out a corporate arm through an IPO, or carving up a Fortune 500 company, that means more fees for bankers and potentially improved returns for investors.
